page.title: 01Corney Fell
page.content: There are 4 principal features in this area which has few buildings and no human habitation. There are three hills Kirmount Buck Barrow, Buck Barrow and Stoneside Hill and an ancient road known as Colney Fell Road. The entire area is within the National Park and part is owned by The National Trust. The road is single track with passing places and is surfaced with tarmac. The road from Bootle to Corney Fell is unsurfaced. Walls are neglected and broken down. The road is used by walkers at Windscale and is too busy for its condition. There is a public bridleway from Low Kirmount to Burn Moor but there is little or no visible signs of it. The area is used for the grazing of sheep and some cattle. The only buildings are abandoned farms at Lambground & High Kinmont.
